trial_identification.studytitle: Phase 0 of 18F FPM Using PET/CT in Patients With a Variety of Malignancies
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Phase 0 Exploratory Microdosing Study of S-(3-18Ffluoropropyl)Homocysteine Hydrochloride; 18FFPM Using PET/CT in Patients With a Variety of Malignancies.

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: other - 18F FPM
Experimental: D-18F FPM -
Experimental: L-18F FPM -
Treatment: other: 18F FPM

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety of D-18F FPM and L-18F FPM administration as measured by occurrence of adverse clinical, biochemical or haematological events following 18F FPM administration
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 28 days following 18F FPM administration (+/- 7 days)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of injected D-18F FPM and L-18F FPM dose in organs of interest.
Percentage of unmetabolized D-18F FPM and L-18F FPM in plasma and urine after radiotracer administration.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 30 (plasma only) and 90 (plasma and urine) minutes post 18F FPM administration

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Absorbed organ doses expressed as micro Sv/MBq of administered D-18F FPM and L-18F FPM, and whole body dose expressed as milliSv/200MBq of administered dose

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Written informed consent obtained prior to any protocol-specific procedures
- Male and female patients with histologically confirmed squamous cell carcinoma
- At least one site of active malignancy, as demonstrated on the pre-study 18F FDG PET/CT scan performed as part of routine clinical care
- Age >/= 18 years
- Life expectancy >/= 3 months
- ECOG Performance score of 0-2
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding females
- Systemic anti-neoplastic therapy within the 2 weeks prior to the pre-study 18F FDG PET/CT scan until after the 18F FPM PET/CT scan
- Any serious medical condition which the investigator feels may interfere with the procedures or evaluations of the study
- Patients unwilling or unable to comply with protocol or with a history of non-compliance or inability to grant informed consent

recruitment.hospital: Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre - East Melbourne

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Cooperative Research Centre for Biomedical Imaging Development

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety and potential effectiveness of the imaging compound 18F FPM for finding sites of malignancies.
